Detailed Description

Interface that supports various operations on a map. By using this class you can alter the visual state of the map by moving, zooming and rotating it.

It also supports operations such as coordinate projection. The class uses only uses WGS84 coordinates.

Definitions: ScreenPoints are relative to the upper left corner of the screen. I.e. ScreenPoint(10,10) refers to the position 10 pixels down and 10 pixels to the right of the upper left corner of the screen.

wf_int32  deltaY

Moves the screen. Unit pixels.

Parameters:
deltaX Positive value means the map is moved that amount of pixels to the right.
deltaY Positive value means the map is moved that amount of pixels upwards.

virtual void WFAPI::MapOperationInterface::setMovementMode ( bool  moving  )  [pure virtual]

Method to indicate if the map is moving continously in order to be able to redraw faster.

Should be called with the value true during movement of the map because of a key being held pressed. Should be called with the value false when movement ends. Can be used to draw the map quicker and uglier when moving and then drawing a nice one when it stops.

Parameters:
moving True if moving, false if not.

virtual void WFAPI::MapOperationInterface::setPoint ( const WGS84Coordinate &  newCoord,
const ScreenPoint &  screenPoint,
double  angleDegrees 
) [pure virtual]

Sets the specified point on the screen to the specified coordinate and rotate around that point.

This method call results in the same thing as below, but more efficiently implemented:

setPoint( newCoord, screenPoint ); setAngle( angleDegrees, screenPoint );

Parameters:
newCoord The new world coordinate to move the specified screen point to.
screenPoint The screen point on the screen to set to the specified world coordinate.
angleDegrees The angle in degrees to rotate around the screenPoint(in degrees).

virtual void WFAPI::MapOperationInterface::setPoint ( const WGS84Coordinate &  newCoord,
const ScreenPoint &  screenPoint 
) [pure virtual]

Sets the specified point on the screen to the specified world coordinate.

Parameters:
newCoord The new world coordinate to move the specified screen point to.
screenPoint The screen point on the screen to set to the specified world coordinate.

virtual double WFAPI::MapOperationInterface::zoom ( double  factor,
const WGS84Coordinate &  zoomCoord,
const ScreenPoint &  zoomPoint 
) [pure virtual]

Zooms in so that a specific point at the screen is located at a a certain coordinate.

Parameters:
factor The factor to zoom in. Value larger than one means zoom in.
zoomCoord The coordinate to zoom in to.
zoomPoint The point on the screen where the zoomCoord should be located.
Returns:
The resulting zoom level.

virtual double WFAPI::MapOperationInterface::zoom ( double  factor  )  [pure virtual]

Zooms the display. Value larger than one means zoom in. Corresponds to setZoomLevel( factor * getZoomLevel() )

Parameters:
factor The factor to zoom in.
Returns:
The resulting zoom level.
